questions.question: What is the correct order of the electromagnetic spectrum from longest to shortest wavelength?
options: Radio, Microwave, Infrared, Visible, Ultraviolet, X-ray, Gamma
Gamma, X-ray, Ultraviolet, Visible, Infrared, Microwave, Radio
Visible, Infrared, Ultraviolet, Radio, Microwave, X-ray, Gamma
Radio, Visible, Infrared, Microwave, Ultraviolet, X-ray, Gamma
questions.explanation: Radio waves have the longest wavelengths (meters to kilometers), gamma rays have the shortest (smaller than atoms).

questions.question: Which type of electromagnetic wave has the highest frequency?
questions.explanation: Gamma rays have the highest frequencies (and shortest wavelengths) in the electromagnetic spectrum.

questions.question: What part of the EM spectrum do human eyes detect?
questions.explanation: Our eyes are sensitive only to visible light, which is a very small portion of the entire electromagnetic spectrum.

questions.question: Which EM waves are used for cooking in microwave ovens?
questions.explanation: Microwave ovens use microwaves to make water molecules vibrate, generating heat to cook food.

questions.question: What type of EM radiation do we feel as heat from the sun?
questions.explanation: Infrared radiation is thermal radiation that we perceive as heat from the sun, fires, or warm objects.

questions.question: Which EM waves are used for medical imaging to see bones?
questions.explanation: X-rays can penetrate soft tissues but are absorbed by bones, making them ideal for medical imaging.

questions.question: What type of EM radiation causes sunburn?
questions.explanation: UV radiation from the sun damages skin cells and causes sunburn. That's why sunscreen is important!

questions.question: Which EM waves are used for TV and radio broadcasting?
questions.explanation: Radio waves have long wavelengths that can travel long distances and pass through buildings, perfect for broadcasting.

questions.question: What is the relationship between wavelength and frequency in the EM spectrum?
questions.explanation: Wavelength and frequency have an inverse relationship: longer wavelength means lower frequency, and vice versa.

questions.question: Which color of visible light has the most energy?
questions.explanation: Violet light has the shortest wavelength and highest frequency in the visible spectrum, giving it the most energy.

questions.question: What type of EM radiation do remote controls use?
questions.explanation: TV remote controls use infrared light, which is invisible to our eyes but can be detected by electronic sensors.

questions.question: Which EM waves are used in airport security scanners?
questions.explanation: Airport body scanners use millimeter waves (a type of microwave) to detect objects under clothing without harmful radiation.

questions.question: What is the speed of all electromagnetic waves in vacuum?
questions.explanation: All electromagnetic waves travel at the speed of light (300,000 km/s) in vacuum, regardless of their wavelength or frequency.

questions.question: Which EM waves are used for cell phone communication?
questions.explanation: Cell phones use radio waves in the microwave frequency range to transmit calls and data.

questions.question: What type of EM radiation is used in night vision goggles?
questions.explanation: Night vision goggles detect infrared radiation (heat) emitted by objects, making them visible in darkness.

questions.question: Which EM waves have wavelengths about the size of a honeybee?
questions.explanation: Microwaves have wavelengths ranging from about 1 millimeter to 1 meter - similar to the size of insects like honeybees.

questions.question: What type of EM radiation is used to kill cancer cells?
questions.explanation: Gamma rays have high energy that can destroy cancer cells in radiation therapy.

questions.question: Which statement about the EM spectrum is true?
options: All EM waves travel at same speed in vacuum
Radio waves are the most dangerous
Visible light has the most energy
Gamma rays have the longest wavelength
questions.explanation: In vacuum, all electromagnetic waves travel at the speed of light, regardless of their type or energy.

questions.question: What type of EM radiation do astronomers use to study distant galaxies?
options: All types - each reveals different information
questions.explanation: Astronomers use the entire EM spectrum - different wavelengths reveal different information about celestial objects.

questions.question: Why is the ozone layer important for life on Earth?
questions.explanation: The ozone layer absorbs most of the sun's harmful ultraviolet radiation, protecting living organisms from DNA damage.
